article.Heading: Budget 2016 India: Sensex, Nifty slip into red; M&M up 3% on Budget proposal
article.Summary: M&M surges 3 percent on government plans to double rural income by 2020 and FY17 and allocation of Rs 87765 crore for rural development in FY17.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

The market seems to be not so happy FM Arun Jaitley continues his Budget speech happy. The Sensex is down 2.94 points at 23151.36, and the Nifty is down 8.35 points at 7021.40. About 935 shares have advanced, 1118 shares declined, and 141 shares are unchanged.

M&M surges 3 percent on government plans to double rural income by 2020 and FY17 and allocation of Rs 87765 crore for rural development in FY17.

Here are few Budget proposals at the moment.

Allocate Rs 2000 crore for initial cost
Mission to provide LPG gas connection to women household members
Propose Rs 87765 crore for rural development in FY17
Allocate Rs 9000 crore towards Swachh Bharat mission
Propose Rs 8500 crore for rural electrification
Rs 38,500 crore allocation to MNREGA
Rs 2.87 lakh crore to be given as grants to aid gram panchayats
Propose Rs 5500 crore for crop insurance scheme for FY17
Rs 15000 crore to be allocated for interest subvention for agriculture loans

Posted by Nasrin Sultana
Follow @NasrinzStory
